arm_group.description: Subjects and at least one of their parents will receive mindful eating based behavioral modification program
Subjects and their parents will receive standard nutritional counseling provided by a registered dietician

brief_summary.textblock:
This study is designed to study the effect of a family based mindfulness training program
      with special focus on diet and nutrition on weight and cardiovascular risk markers in obese
      adolescents.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of Mindful Eating on Body Mass Index in Obese Adolescents

detailed_description.textblock:
40 obese adolescents would be randomized into either a mindfulness based behavioral
      modification program or standard dietary counseling. At least one parent would be expected
      to attend the counseling sessions. Patients would be followed for a period of 6 months.
      Anthropometric parameters, questionaiires relating to quality of life and blood tests would
      be drawn at baseline and and at 6 months.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria

          -  BMI at or greater than the 95th percentile for age and gender

        Exclusion Criteria

intervention.description: Subjects and their parents will receive mindful eating based behavioral modification program over multiple sessions

clinical_study.official_title: Effect of Mindful Eating on Body Mass Index and Cardiovascular Risk Markers in Obese Adolescents: A Pilot Randomized Clinical Trial

primary_outcome.description: Body Mass Index would be calculated at baseline, at 3 months and at 6 months

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Well validated questionnaires of quality of life would be assessed at baseline, at 3 months and at 6 months.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment
